timeline.body:
```
        return getElement().getProperty(ElementConstants.LABEL_PROPERTY_NAME, "");
```
Because currently all of our text components like `TextField` work in an inconsistent way and return either `null` for initial value or `""` if cleared after value has been set, we will discuss internally that how we want to fix this design flaw that is existing. I'll comment later on if/how we'll want to change the current behavior.
timeline.bodyText:
return getElement().getProperty(ElementConstants.LABEL_PROPERTY_NAME, "");

Because currently all of our text components like TextField work in an inconsistent way and return either null for initial value or "" if cleared after value has been set, we will discuss internally that how we want to fix this design flaw that is existing. I'll comment later on if/how we'll want to change the current behavior.

return getElement().getProperty(ElementConstants.LABEL_PROPERTY_NAME, "");

Because currently all of our text components like TextField work in an inconsistent way and return either null for initial value or "" if cleared after value has been set, we will discuss internally that how we want to fix this design flaw that is existing. I'll comment later on if/how we'll want to change the current behavior.

See the + * License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations under + * the License. + */ +package com.vaadin.flow.component; + +import com.vaadin.flow.dom.ElementConstants; + +/** + * A component that supports label definition. + *

+ * The default implementations set the label of the component to the given text for + * {@link #getElement()}. Override all methods in this interface if the text + * should be added to some other element. + * + * + * @author Vaadin Ltd + * @since 3.0 + */ +public interface HasLabel extends HasElement{ + /** + * Set the label of the component to the given text. + * + * @param label + * the label text to set + */ + default void setLabel(String label) { + getElement().setProperty(ElementConstants.LABEL_PROPERTY_NAME, label == null ? "" : label); + } + + /** + * Gets the label of the component. + * + * @return the label of the component or "" if no label has + * been set + */ + default String getLabel() { + return getElement().getProperty(ElementConstants.LABEL_PROPERTY_NAME, "");

replies.bodyText: Ok, sure. Let me know when there's a decision 👍
replies.author: ovidiupopa91

replies.bodyText:
Sorry for the delay.
The decision is to go with returning null for the default value when setLabel(null) has been done.
Please change the setter to also just to pass null as the value of the property and not "".
replies.author: pleku

replies.bodyText:
HI @pleku . Just updated the implementation and the unit tests. Also I added 2 new unit tests.
Let me know if there is something else that I should improve.
replies.author: ovidiupopa91

timeline.message:
Create new mixin interface HasLabel(#3241)

Add new HasLabel interface to be used by components that supports label
definitions

Fix sonar issue

Move LABEL_PROPERTY_NAME constant to ElementConstants class
Make since tag empty for now

Create new mixin interface HasLabel(#3241)

Add new HasLabel interface to be used by components that supports label
definitions

Fix sonar issue

Move LABEL_PROPERTY_NAME constant to ElementConstants class
Make since tag empty for now

Update HasLabel mixin interface to return null as default value(#3241)

changed from empty string default value to null
updated the unit tests and added a few more to check the behaviour of
the HasLabel mixin interface
